Dower.definition: the life estate in a man's real property to which his wife is entitled upon his death under common law and some state statutes compare curtesy
Dower.origin: [Anglo-French, from Old French douaire , modification of Medieval Latin dotarium , from Latin dot - dos gift, dowry]

1.1: the life estate in a man's real property to which his wife is entitled upon his death under common law and some state statutes compare
